job_title: Information Centre Advisor in Leicester, England
pros: great experience, great people and good pay
cons: not anything that I can think of

job_title: Additional Support for Learning Assistant in Leicester, England
pros: Inclusive and embraces equality and diversity. Team-orientated to draw on skills and strengths.
cons: Challenging environment dealing with a diverse community so you need resilience, empathy and flexibility.

review_title: They care more about money and targets above the wellbeing of their staff
pros: Some colleagues are lovely to work with, some are so unhappy that they would like to leave but are stuck in a job.
cons: low salary no flexibility no care for employees raise a issue and you will be classed as a trouble maker

review_title: Low stress employer full of typical Education sector politics
pros: Relaxed pace of work, pension, generous holidays, comfortable working conditions.
cons: Low pay versus industry, often nonsensical decision-making from above and budgetary limitations.

pros: Great team and down to earth people

job_title: Business Enterprise Manager in Leicester, England
pros: Lots of supportive staff and great management team.
cons: Not much room to progress your career.

pros: Friendly team, nice working environment and plenty of support if you ask for it.
cons: Quite disorganised and chaotic, not much onboarding so you have to be proactive in getting any training you need. Will be quite a shock if you are coming from the private sector.

pros: The teaching teams are often diverse and will include different styles of teaching that you can learn from as a new teacher. In addition, the College supports upskilling and encouraging staff to attend learning to enable teachers to be informed about a range of teaching styles.
cons: At times management will implement initiatives only to tick a box, at the expense of the teachers and their time.

pros: Possibility of academic progress, normal working hours for most of the year. Time for family life.
cons: Not an equal opportunities employer, initially seems like it's individuals but then you realise it extends through to management. RACIST
